Title: Business and Data Analyst
Description:
Business & Data Analyst - Alphabyte Solutions, Inc. (Vaughan, ON)
https://alphabyte.ai
About the Alphabyte Family:
Based in Toronto, Canada, Alphabyte embodies the entrepreneurial spirit of Canada’s start-up scene. For years, we have based this on the premise that with a little thoughtfulness and determination, anything can be done a little bit better, and a little bit faster.
A leader in IT and Data services, Alphabyte’s portfolios extends across North America, Europe, and Australia. A truly global corporate citizen, we are committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change. In addition to the cool gadgets which we invent and work with, we are constantly striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment, as well as taking part in our communities through philanthropic efforts.
The Alphabyte Team thrives on thinking outside of the box while maintaining a commitment to our values. We ensure that we keep up with the times, and as the Data industry makes the transition from Big Data Analytics to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning - we ensure that we remain at the forefront of innovation. Underneath it, we are driven by an eagerness to make an impact as a team.
About the Role:
As a Business and Data Analyst, you will become an integral part of the Alphabyte team, where you will combine your Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, and Programming skills to become a cohesive link which ties together the various facets of the organization, as well as provide database support and ensure that our code-base, and our client infrastructure remains in a healthy state.
On a day to day basis, you will also be overseeing much of the Development, Quality Assurance, User Acceptance Testing, and Reporting within the organization. You will be a Guru of end-user satisfaction of Alphabyte’s Solutions and Products.
What is Required of You:
· Strategic and personable communicator
· Resourceful, creative, and team oriented
· Strong data analysis skills, ability to recognize patterns in numbers and charts
· Highly detail oriented self-starter who works well under pressure and turns complex situations into ideas, strategies and actions
· Requires minimal supervision and is able to manage through ambiguity
· Strong organizational skills, with an ability to adapt and deliver results in a fast-paced environment
· Bi-lingual in technology and business, able to communicate technical issues into business terms and vice-versa.
Knowledge and Experience:
· 5+ Years working in a fast-paced IT environment
· 3+ Years working with SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL)
· 3+ Years working with an end-to-end Microsoft stack
· 1+ Years working with Microsoft's Azure Cloud environment
· 2+ Years managing users within AD Groups and Workspaces, ensuring the reliability of access in Outlook, SharePoint, SQL Server, Windows Servers and VM's, MS Power BI
· 3+ Years in reporting, and/or data analysis using Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools
· Basic knowledge of .NET (C#)
Skills Required
· Bachelors in Engineering, Computer Science, or a Quantitative Field such as Math/Statistics
· SQL (3+ years)
· Python
· Power BI / Tableau
Additional Consideration If you have:
· Experience working with Microsoft Data Factory
· C / C++ / Unix
· 6-Sigma Certification
· Can provide a detailed cover letter with additional “real life scenarios” where you’ve applied your skillset in a trying situation or setting
· Having great appreciation for all kinds of Coffee or Sports Trivia
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
SQL: 3 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Required)
Language:
English (Required)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary: Under the direction of the Assessment Librarian, the Data Analyst is responsible for providing technical support and operational oversight for the analysis and visualization of library data. The Data Analyst works with librarians and staff across the University of Toronto libraries to gather, standardize, analyze and visualize data to meet external reporting and accountability requirements and to support library initiatives and planning. Extracts, transforms, manipulates, converts and reports on data and statistics. Creates dashboards for various data collections and projects. Maintains and updates data inventories.

Qualifications:
(Minimum)
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer or Data Science or acceptable combination of education & experience.

Experience:
Three years of related experience.
Experience working with Tableau or equivalent data visualization tool.
Strong working knowledge of relational databases and query structure. Experience writing scripts in R, Python, PHP and/or Java Script.
Experience using APIs to retrieve and parse data.
Experience coding in at least one language.
One or more years of data modelling and database schema experience.
Demonstrated experience using Excel and), database management tools (e.g. Access, SQL); Internet, and presentation packages (Power Point).
Ability to work independently and in a team. Excellent analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
Effective communication skills, including the ability to clearly and concisely express complex concepts in simple terms and communicate technical information to non-technical staff.
Demonstrated skill and experience in data manipulation, management, and analysis.
Knowledge of project management principles and experience completing complex projects within timelines.
Other Skills:
Accuracy, attention to detail and ability to break complex projects into a logical sequence of tasks.
Familiarity with statistical principles, especially descriptive statistics.
Knowledge, training or experience in data visualization best practices.
Demonstrated ability in project planning and design using considerable judgment, initiative, and innovation in decision-making.
Experience working in a higher-education setting.
Demonstrated interest in Data Science


Travel: None

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TECHNATION
Connecting Technology, Government and Community for Canada’s Future. A clear reflection of our role and mandate to our members and our nation.

TECHNATION (formerly Information Technology Association of Canada (ITAC)) is seeking a full-time Data Analyst within the Future Workforce Development team.

About Us

TECHNATION is Canada’s national business association representing a diverse membership that is at the forefront of Canada’s digital economy. Our members include some of the largest global tech companies, but also a high number of innovate small and medium sized companies. Talent is the foundation of both Canada’s rapidly expanding ICT sector and of ICT-based innovations and capabilities in every sector of our economy.

Position Location

5090 Explorer Drive, Suite 510, Mississauga, Ontario, Canada, L4W 4T9

About the Role

Reports to A/VP, Future Workforce Development

This is a fixed term contract:

Start date: May 1st, 2020

End date: March 1st, 2022

Full time, 40 hours per week

Work may require effort beyond normal working hours and occasionally on weekends.

Work may require occasional travel within Canada and the U.S. to attend conferences or support Future Workforce Development initiatives.

The successful candidate will:

Manage and support TECHNATION workforce development data analysis needs to include:

o Plan, analyze, and report on key data points on the Canadian workforce from multiple sources

o Monitor Canadian labour market information for ICT trends,

o Conduct online research of Canadian technical educational & training programs/program components

o Liaise with national data generators and tap into data sources to support TECHNATION requirements

o Support execution of interviews, focus groups and surveys in support of TECHNATION Future Workforce Development requirements

o Develop and support data lifecycle management

o Draft reports and recommendations

Support definition, development and maintenance of data sets used in TECHNATION platform/workforce development applications

o Advise on data collection, analysis and reporting in terms of the application of artificial intelligence and data science in the Future Workforce Development Programs and online tools (realizing that this is an emergent field, basic knowledge is required with the expectation that the Analyst’s learning and experience in the role will enhance their ability to advise in this area).

o Lead data structure and data definition discussions within TN to support improved data capture, use and management

o Investigate and support development of technical statement of requirements related to data and data management

o Participate in testing of tools once delivered by vendor prior to roll out, including assisting in the development and completion of a requirements acceptance matrix based on technical and non-technical requirements

o Provide database management support

o As a ‘content manager’, identify and modify content within TECHNATION workforce development applications

Other tasks as required to support the project including:

o Supporting TECHNATION events and meetings as required

o Assist with acquisition and the coordination of translation

o Tracking and reporting on key performance indicators

o Minor project management and working with TECHNATION leaders to scope project requirements and monitor project deliverables

o Developing briefs and conducting presentations

o Research to maximize participant experience, improve efficiency and solidify the TECHNATION brand

o Other duties as assigned

Mandatory Qualifications:

Diploma or degree in IT, data analysis, database management, econometrics or related field where data analysis is a key function.

3+ years of experience working in an electronic data-driven environment to include data analysis and reporting and data lifecycle management

Experience in employment or job-based research, analysis and reporting

Education and experience in quantitative and qualitative research

Intermediate to advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 Suite components (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, Teams, etc.)

Ability to work independently and simultaneously manage multiple work projects

Strong ability to work within a highly dynamic, interdependent and collaborative team

Ability to plan and manage multiple projects simultaneously

Mandatory Qualifications (cont’d):

Knowledge of application of AI and Machine Learning principles as applied to data analysis, management and visualization

Desirable characteristics:

Post-graduate certificate in data analysis or similar

Bilingualism (French/English)

Flexibility and adaptability

Ability to exercise foresight

Innovative mindset

Key Relationships:

Directly reporting to:

Acting Vice President Future Workforce Development

Additional Key relationships:

Senior Program Director Artificial Intelligence and Cybersecurity Skills Initiative (AICSI)

Senior Project Manager (TECHNATION Platforms and Applications)

Career Ready Program Manager

What we Offer

TECHNATION is a dynamic and engaging organization with a dynamic team. We manage and lead national events, speaking forums, and educational programs that impact businesses across the country. If you like being involved in leading-edge programs that are going to impact our nation, then TECHNATION is for you! We offer:

Competitive salary and benefit package; and
Paid vacations and holidays.

We are committed to diversity in its workplaces and encourage applications from all visible minority groups, women, Aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities among other self-identified diverse groups. We also provide accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for a disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify us.

To learn more visit www.itactalent.ca

To apply, please submit a cover letter with resume to jhall@technationcanada.ca by March 20, 2020
Please note: only applications that include both a cover letter and resume will be reviewed

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst
Mississauga
127031011
At Arubrum, we specialize in IT & business solutions that drive growth. We are currently looking for a Junior Data Analyst for a full-time, contract position. This role is a client facing role where you will be working for our Fortune 500 client to deliver actionable marketing insights.
In this role, your primary duties will include collecting, cleaning, visualizing and analyzing market and customer information. Working with a team of experienced analysts, you will have the opportunity to participate in projects that have broad implications in the Canadian market and will have a direct impact on the client’s customer base across the country. If you embrace challenges and thrive in a fast-paced environment, Arubrum welcomes your application.
Responsibilities:
Conduct primary and secondary research to collect materials pertaining to the project
Collect data and develop visualization using best practices and templates
Develop and maintain highly effective dashboards and reports
Learn existing datasets, structures, and definitions and seek out new data sets to complement existing data
Assist in competitive analysis to build better, more efficient marketing strategies
Compile and organize analyses on customer segments and projects to provide insights to stakeholders allowing them to make data driven decisions
Explore new sources of data representation to uncover new opportunities at all levels of the business
Collaborate with cross-functional teams for team building and ad-hoc tasks
Skills Required:
Degree or Diploma in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related field
1-2 years of experience using Excel and SQL
Proficiency with joins, subqueries, pattern matching keywords, advanced functions etc.
Keen attention to detail, ability to ensure high level of accuracy under tight deadlines
Team player and the willingness to elevate others
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Valid G-Class license is an asset
We actively promote diverse work environment and encourage applications from all persons. We are an equal opportunity organization
Reference ID: 127031011
Job Types: Full-time, Contract

1+ years of IT or related business experience
Excellent organizational and problem solving skills

Strong customer service skills

Aptitude for numbers, accuracy, and analysis
Ability to work quickly and accurately under pressure
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to utilize new systems and tools

Title: Senior Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Job Description:
Are you ready for a new challenge? This is your opportunity to help transform one of Canada's largest and most trusted companies. We operate like a start-up and offer a challenging, team-oriented work environment, competitive income and benefits, opportunities for professional and personal growth, and a highly collaborative work environment.

About the role
Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: London, Toronto or Winnipeg.
As part of the Canadian Technology and the Data Team, the Senior Data Governance Analyst will report into the Manager, Data Governance. You will be accountable for defining, reporting, and operating data stewardship and metadata management across our Canadian operations. This is a great opportunity to work across the stakeholders to consult and advise on how our data is utilized. You will champion our data catalogue, configuring it from soup to nuts to promote data adoption in our company along with a small team of data management experienced professionals.

In your role, you will define the Data Operation and Reporting responsibilities through:
Act as the project lead for metadata to ensure technology solutions meet business needs
Work with technology to ensure metadata is reflected in the business glossary and data dictionaries equipping users to self-serve on the data
Define requirements and complete analysis as we build out the common data repository, connecting our company to hundreds of source systems
Communicate, and operationalize data-related processes and procedures to support data governance, including metrics and reporting
Identify opportunities to improve effectiveness of the data organization with focus on operational efficiency and collaboration across business units
Identify and map Critical Data Elements (CDEs) from business request to systems
Provide leadership and expertise in support of the data governance process, including policy reviews, metrics, and reporting
Translate a complex topic into simple and effective statements that have impact
Raise visibility of strategic decisions, issues, risks, and milestones related to data initiatives
Communicate and report results for Data Governance efforts, championing data initiatives
Build data awareness and overtime, become an expert for data sources across Canada
Collaborate closely with business, technology, and other representatives

From a Metadata Management perspective:
Define our strategy and requirements for Canadian metadata
Manage metadata in selected technology platforms (business glossary, discovery tools, etc)
Interface with technology to ensure data and metadata requirements are well understood
Champion our metadata journey, showing clear benefits monthly

Who you are:
3-5+ years of applied data management experience
Certification in data management, accounting, or business analysis an asset
Working knowledge of Data toolset an asset such as IGC, Collibra, and Alation
Expert in Microsoft products (PowerPoint and Excel)
Experience in financial services and insurance is an asset
Awareness and understanding of database theory and analytics techniques
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Strong organization skills
Agile, practical, customer service oriented mindset (doesn’t over complicate processes)
Generally curious and excited to learn new things
LI-AC1
Our Story

Canada Life is a leading insurance, wealth management and benefits provider focused on improving the financial, physical and mental well-being of Canadians. For more than 170 years, individuals, families and business owners across Canada have trusted us to provide sound guidance and deliver on the promises we’ve made.

As of January 1, 2020, Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life became one company – Canada Life, and today, we proudly serve more than 13 million customer relationships from coast to coast to coast.

Discover your opportunity….Apply today!

Canada Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days not to mention onsite cafeteria and fitness in our head office facilities. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself.

Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.

Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
The role is responsible for designing, developing, manipulating and maintaining financial reporting systems, as well as interpreting data that influence and drive decisions. This includes identifying needs, creating process improvement solutions, working with multiple stakeholders and maintaining collaborative relationships with business partners.

To be successful in the role, the candidate brings a solid working knowledge of SQL, Tableau, Python and process automation. In addition, the candidate is a self-starter with a passion for providing various ways to improve effectiveness within the business.

You will be accountable to:
Meet with various business units to understand their needs, identify the business problem, determine, define and deploy predictive/prescriptive analytic solutions to meet business objectives.
Prepare, extract data and perform data manipulation by using various programming language (SQL, Python etc.).
Use machine learning methods or other data mining techniques to get insights from massive datasets.
Work closely with data analysts, data engineers, data scientist and other team members on projects and ad-hoc requests.
Communicate approaches, findings and recommendations to business stakeholders.
Strictly adhere to legal and compliance guidelines regarding access and exposure to sensitive and confidential information.

Your experience includes:
Bachelor or Masters’ degree in an analytical field of study e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Finance, Computer Science.
3 - 5 years of work experience directly related to quantitative analysis, with proven results.
Familiar with tools such as SQL/Python/Data Bricks or other tools for large scale data analysis.
Solid knowledge and some hands-on experience with various machine learning algorithms e.g. time series analysis, anomaly detection, cluster analysis, decision trees, random forest, SVM.
Superb analytical and conceptual thinking skills to not only manipulate but also derive meaningful interpretations from data.
Ability to take initiative, multi-task, and is a good team player in a fast-paced environment.
Strong detail orientation is essential in this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why join us?
We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst to join our Pension Technology team in Toronto. In this role, you will design and build interactive data visualization using tools like Power BI to provide insights and ensure the solution solves the business problem in the most efficient and interpretable form for business users.

The analyst will act as a bridge between business users and technology specialists. The analyst will work with business-unit leaders to identify and prioritize problems that analytics is suited to solve and help identify the business data needed to produce the most useful insights. The person will be responsible to synthesizes complex analytics-derived insights into easy-to-understand, actionable recommendations that business users can easily extract and execute on and drives adoption among business users.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Translating business problems into analytic problems by engaging stakeholders, facilitating the discussions to identify the opportunities where analytics can make a difference, and establish a partnership with BRM to prioritize the opportunities to align with other ongoing initiatives.
Leading and executing analytics projects to provide insights and act as analytics experts on to identify use cases best suited for analytics and machine learning projects. Research new and innovative methods to solve machine learning problems to solve complex business problems.
Working with the data architects, engineers, and scientists to carve out solutions that can support ongoing and future analytical capabilities. Understanding supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques and can collaborate with data teams to deliver innovative solutions using advanced analytics techniques.
Participating in the development of analytics solutions and predictive models to provide business context. Understanding the statistical model to perform statistical analysis and propose hypothesis testing to improve the solution. Work with technical teams to evaluate the solution.
Designing and building interactive data visualization using tools like Power BI to provide insights.
Preparing and delivering insights presentations to communicate results to stakeholders and action recommendations. Propose and discuss options with stakeholders to develop the feasibility.
Explaining technical concepts with examples to a non-technical audience and prepare training material and presentation to explain complex Machine Learning concepts. Providing support to other team members in documentation and presentation to establish an analytics framework and implement best practices for analytics development.
To succeed in this role, you have:
Advanced degree in Information Systems, Business Analytics, Data Science, Business, Accounting, Finance, or related discipline with 2 to 5 years of experience.
Excellent data visualization skills and experience of developing dashboards using Power BI. Strong ability to communicate quantitative data into a visually engaging story. Good understanding of the data science process and machine learning algorithms with experience of developing data models and writing SQL. Working knowledge of Python, R, TensorFlow, Databricks, Spark, and Azure platform.
Experience in transforming business problems into analytics use cases. Ability to think critically and use domain knowledge of Finance and HR to identify areas of improvement by reviewing existing business processes.
Experience in solving the analytical problem, develop a narrative based on insights and communicate complex analytical solutions and business impact of the implementation. Experience in organizing a large amount of information into a concise presentation.
Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills. Experience in writing business cases with strong skills in the documentation. Advanced skills in PowerPoint and Excel. Experience in participating in workshops and delivering training. Familiarity with agile project management concepts is a plus.
Our story:
ABOUT OMERS
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $97 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2018. A jointly sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers, OMERS invests and administers pensions on behalf of almost half a million active and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS has employees in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. For more information on OMERS, visit www.omers.com .
OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. Diversity and Inclusion at OMERS means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities and perspectives as key elements of our culture. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation.

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
Cardinal Health is seeking a Data Management Analyst to add to our team in Vaughan. The Data Management Analyst is accountable for the integrity and maintenance of Master Data to support the health of the system functionality. This individual is responsible for analyzing Master Data procedures and content in order to highlight areas of improvement. They will work collaboratively and cross-functionally with other Teams, namely Business Intelligence, Sales, Supply Chain, and Marketing, to develop suggested solutions that will gain efficiency and accuracy for the master data, such as Item Master, Customer Master, and Supplier Master.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop cross-functional relationships with Business Intelligence, Supply Chain, Sales, Marketing and Application Services regarding the maintenance and workability of master data content.
Provide ownership of the processes involved in master data maintenance and implement improvement strategies to standardize the approaches to these functions.
Conduct data profiling and analysis to validate master data integrity and consistency.
Develop and maintain monitoring procedures to alert respective data owners about data exceptions. Identify root causes for repeat errors and suggest process and/or system improvements.
Identify KPIs to measure and report data quality. Track and report results of data quality improvement initiatives.
Create and maintain documentation necessary for master data governance. Educate organization on master data process changes and data management best practices
Perform regular data management duties related to item merchandising, item cost changes and analysis, and other data maintenance as required.
Know-how and Experience:
A bachelor’s degree in business, engineering or computer science is an asset.
An excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Understanding of master data principles
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel
Working knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to provide coaching and training to others.
Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting an accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.
Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst
Term: 12 months (contract) Number of Positions: 8 Anticipated Start Date: Immediate
Location
Toronto , Canada
Your job
Position Overview: Responsible for ensuring reinsurance data is processed in a timely, complete and accurate manner and meets the needs of key business partners. Reinsurance Operations (RO) is an integral part of Munich Re; responsible for the end-to-end processing of Life and Living Benefits treaties (reinsurance contracts with ceding companies) and corresponding client data. As a vital member of the team, joining our Center of Excellence (COE); the successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring reinsurance data on assigned client accounts is processed with a high level of accuracy and efficiency. Key Accountabilities:
Using a Business Process Management tool, updates business rules/logic to translate complex client data, through analysis of data, product specifications, and treaty parameters. Understands the different data streams for a transaction data, claims, retro, and billing data.
Ensures translated client data meets minimum data requirements and Munich Re Quality Control standards for accurate interpretation and processing to the Corporate Administration System.
Accurately maps client plan codes to correct Treaty and plan.
Conducts comprehensive data integrity testing to ensure expected results are released to production.
Determines resolution of records that failed validations through root cause analysis, develops and follows through on a plan of action for correction. Identifies and escalates financial impacts or business risks to Management.
Ensures cessions fall within treaty and underwriting limits.
Assists business partners, (Corporate, Pricing, Underwriting, Claims, and Finance) with data inquiries using basic SQL queries to extract, analyze, and distribute accurate data.

Your profile
Qualifications:
University Degree and 1-2 years of experience.
Proficient in programming languages, prior SQL experience
Thorough working knowledge of Microsoft Software (Excel, Access, Outlook etc), and Power BI
Basic understanding of database structures
Able to resolve routine problems. Progressing towards resolving non routine issues and data related problems.
Immediately escalates issues that impede work deliverables.
Excellent communication skills, oral and written.
Dedicated to meet the expectations and requirements of customers and acts with customers in mind.
About us
Munich Re’s track record as one of the world’s leading reinsurance companies is based on a solid capital foundation, in-depth risk expertise and market know-how. Our data, our technology, and our teams place us in a unique position to lead the change to redefine the nature and impact of reinsurance for the future. We’re investing strategically in our world class talent, offering our employees a diverse and challenging work environment which promotes professional development, innovation, and passion – and rewards high performance.

Apply now! Apply for this Job!

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Data Management
Description:
What is the opportunity?
As a Senior Business Analyst you will get an opportunity to work on multiple reference data projects covering security data, book data, client data, with an initial focus client and book data. The overarching team is responsible for delivering Data Change to support Capital Markets and to a lesser extent I&TS and Wealth Management. Projects are either internally driven to enhance capabilities and efficiencies or externally driven by regulatory needs or business driven initiatives. This is a full time permanent role.
What will you do?
Work with other BAs and PMs in the change team to ensure effective delivery of analysis and requirements, by working with IT and BAU teams to deliver successful change
Contribute to the advancement of the data management goals as well as to raising visibility to the value of the data work through ongoing communications and successful delivery
Lead workshops with stakeholder’s and SME’s to drive out business requirements
Produce high quality documentation through effective business analysis, primarily mapping and streamline the current processes and defining requirement documentation and future process
Development project plans and action plans and manage all aspects of the delivery to these deliverables
Manage UAT for medium and large projects, Define test scenarios and expected results for UAT
Assisting in preparation of training material for when processes are implemented with the business
Define and Communicate the impact of changes through cost-benefit analysis taking into consideration time, effort, and business priorities

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
5+ years working as a Business Analyst/Business System Analyst with progressively increasing responsibilities in the areas of requirements management on large and complex projects within the banking/Finance sector.
Complete understanding of the Project Management Lifecycle and various techniques including Waterfall and Agile methodologies
Outstanding analytical and organizational skills with an attention to detail. Tenacity to identify the root cause of problems is essential
Capability to quickly switch contexts between strategic and detailed analyses, as the ability to adapt to shifting priorities with a sense of urgency
Requirements elicitation techniques such as Document analysis, Interviews, Facilitated workshops, Observation, Prototyping, Focus groups, Surveys
Requirements management and communication – requirements walkthroughs; scope and change management; traceability; configuration management, Backlog Management
Capability to function with a high degree of autonomy, but effectively seek guidance when issues are of relative criticality, strategic importance or have an enterprise impact
Capability to communicate well and work with staff from a variety teams and all levels. Adapt approach accordingly to ensure successful delivery
Business Analysis techniques including use cases, traceability and gap analysis, process flow diagrams. Extensive experience in using Visio, Excel , Basic SQL or adept in using data query tool

Nice-to-have
Knowledge of the Front-to-Back office client reference data workflows, systems, processes and controls and knowledge of reference data and MDM platforms
A working knowledge of key Capital Markets products
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Project Management Institute –Professional in Business Analysis Certification (PMI – PBA) (Preferred)
Masters Certificate in Business Analysis (Preferred)
Agile methodology knowledge and experience
Prior use of ALM / HPQC / JIRA
Experience of working with Global Teams

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Flexible work/life balance options

Join our Talent Community
Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: Asset Data Analyst (Student) - Summer 2020
Description:
Under the direction of the Manager, Asset Management, the Asset Data Analyst (Student) will identify data requirements related to inspection, operations, rehabilitation, and condition assessment of municipal assets including roads, watermains, and bridges. The Asset Data Analyst (Student) will also participate in meetings, provide support to the Asset Management Specialists and collaborate with other Town departments as required.
Job Requirements
Currently enrolled in college-level program in engineering or technology, or a university degree in computer science, geography, engineering, environmental science, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Must have experience using Geography Information Systems (Esri, ArcGIS preferred).
Experience building excel models an asset.
Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Keen attention to detail, highly self-motivated/directed, proven analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Good communication (verbal and written), interpersonal, customer service, and organizational skills.
Ability to work with minimal supervision and in a team oriented and collaborative environment.
Ability to absorb and retain information quickly and be able to present ideas in user-friendly language.
Class G driver’s license in good standing and a reliable vehicle to use while on corporate business.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
About QuadReal
Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, QuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company. QuadReal manages the real estate and mortgage programs of British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI), one of Canada’s largest asset managers with a $153.4 billion portfolio.
QuadReal manages a $37.6 billion portfolio spanning 23 Global Cities across 17 countries. The company seeks to deliver strong investment returns while creating sustainable environments that bring value to the people and communities it serves. Now and for generations to come.
QuadReal: Excellence lives here.
www.quadreal.com
Role Description:
The Data Governance Office at QuadReal is a global function dedicated to producing, promoting, and supporting the availability of the quality information required to create data as a competitive advantage.

Reporting to the Data Governance Manager, the Data Governance Analyst also takes direction from the Enterprise Content Manager and Vice President of Data Management. This role collaboratively supports the roll out and maintenance of the operational framework to facilitate data governance and enterprise content management. This role supports the Data Governance (DG) program by facilitating the execution and integration of Data Governance, Data Quality and Data Management processes across the enterprise, within IT and business functions.

Key responsibilities of this role include acting as the communication hub for Data Management; administrator and content manager for the implementation of a new enterprise data governance tool, Collibra; process and tool training and support of business and IT staff; facilitating data quality improvement initiatives and remediation workgroups; managing the business glossary and assisting with taxonomy; managing the case management system; maintaining collaboration sites and preparing data governance adoption metrics and data quality status for stakeholders. The Data Management Office is in a building phase and is seeking talent committed to innovation and change.
Responsibilities:
Communication Hub
Track Relationship Management engagement, such as DG Council, Data Steward Network, Workshop Participants and other key stakeholders.
In consultation with the DG Manager and Enterprise Document Manager, maintain and identify impacts, and adjusts DG and business glossary standards, guidelines, and processes and communicates accordingly.
Track DG issues, escalations and compliance.
Point of contact for the DG group, referring questions to others in the group or outside the group (to Stewards and SMEs) as appropriate.
Organize training for data education, business glossary, standards, etc.
Draft and execute communications for DG.
Maintain DG adoption KPI’s and metrics.

Collibra Administrator
Execute the implementation of Collibra.
Work with the vendor (Collibra) to resolve issues.
Provide support (technical and business) for both hardware and software issues that may arise.
Manage the system daily and respond quickly to any questions.
Engage IT partners (Cybersecurity, IT Infrastructure) to resolve any issues or concerns.
Backup information and verify that backups have been completed.
Regularly manage continuous improvement as needed.
Business Glossary - capturing details for key enterprise data concepts
Maintain integrity of the business glossary.
Administer access to and functionality of the business glossary.
Identify and acquire business glossary entries by soliciting the business for training materials, etc.
Load and enter business glossary entries as identified through acquisition or working group results.
Review glossary and approve readiness to load, and check approval status and approval workflow status.
Accept project work required for glossary.
Assist in the build out of QuadReal taxonomy.

Case Management
Administer the case management (Issues) list.
Based on issues identified by ECM manager, Data Governance Manager, Data Governance Council, Data Quality Issues or Steward Network, etc. create, manage and track case initiatives.
Work with case stakeholders to identify necessary participants.
Project manage cases by convening a working group, develops meeting materials, sets-up meetings and working groups on relevant data topics, develops meeting agendas, performs pre-meeting research and determines attendee lists.
Assist the working group meetings, ensuring movement towards decision by recording action items, owners and completion criteria and ensuring participation.
Take minutes at working groups and publishes them.
Report back to the identifier the progress and results of the case resolution.
Check in with stewards/projects to ensure changes are completed in a timely manner.

Reporting - Develops and manages data governance, data quality and data management progress reporting, including:
Experience with measuring and testing data quality including the generation of DQ scorecards.
Report on the status of Case Management progress. Highlight high priority items for the DG team to address. Highlight lingering items for action.
Generate and deliver DG reports and dashboards in Collibra.
Participate in DM meetings, provide updates on status and issues.
Manage DM agendas and follow up on action items through resolution.
Manage, maintain and publish DG adoption metrics.
Create reports and communications on business participation in Data Governance Council, Data Steward Network, Workshops.
Collaboration sites and content
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of our internal DM community website, including set up and content.
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of our department site to capitalize on Microsoft Teams.
Other duties as necessary to supports support the DG lead in achieving the data management enablement program of work, including;
Work within IT to adapt the software development lifecycle to include the data management lifecycle (technology).
Work with the business to roll out the business operating model.
Work to support projects within the program.
Work to support the organizational change management program.
Experience and Qualifications:
Experience with managing data governance tools (e.g. Collibra, Informatica, Alation, IBM) preferred including data quality.
Time spent in a Data Governance role as Data Governance Analyst, Data Quality Analyst, Data Steward or Data Manager.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Statistics, Business Management or equivalent experience.
Certification as a CDP (Certified Data Professional) with a Data Governance component or CDMP (Certified Data Management Professional) is a bonus.
Experience with using Python, Visual Basic, SQL, Excel, or similar is preferred
Must be able to effectively communicate with stakeholders at all levels and to influence change.
Ability to identify and remediate data issues through root cause analysis.
Customer-focused, team player with a desire to continuously improve current business practices/processes.
Experience supporting data-cleansing initiatives.
Experience in the creation and delivery of training material, presentations and processes
Well rounded skill set comprised of a blend of business and technical acumen.
Enthusiastic, self-starter that requires minimal direction and delivers with integrity
QuadReal Property Group will provide reasonable accommodation at any time throughout the hiring process for applicants with disabilities or for those needing job postings in an alternate format. If you require accommodation, please advise the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with and include the following: Job posting #, your name and your preferred method of contact.
Want to learn about our end-to-end recruitment process? Click this link for a short video that will take you through each step, so you’ll know exactly what to expect.

Title: Data & Insights Analyst, Pension Administration
Description:
Do you enjoy solving puzzles, optimizing processes and turning data into easily understandable and insightful stories? Want to be part of a bright and ambitious team that pushes pension administrators to do what’s best for their members?
CEM Benchmarking (CEM) helps institutional investors manage their costs and optimize their performance. In the last 30 years, more than 1,000 global funds have provided us with investment and pension administration data. We provide funds with meaningful, actionable analytics based on our one- of-a-kind database.
Most of our 400+ clients are pension funds. Pension funds have a fiduciary responsibility to deliver outstanding retirement security to their members. Our clients also hold $10 trillion in assets. They have tremendous power to effect positive change. With our insights we help our clients become better fiduciaries for their members.
What are our expectations?
We appreciate it takes time to write a great application. Please read the following carefully, before you write back - we don’t want to waste your time.
Please do not respond:
Without writing a custom cover letter that explains how you would be a valuable fit to CEM. This is a great tool to showcase your knowledge and skills.
If you don’t have a track record of higher education or work experience in an analytical field. Employees with superior analytic skills and logical systems thinkers do well at CEM.
If you cannot demonstrate business and/or technical writing skills.
If you cannot demonstrate advanced Excel knowledge, including VBA skills.
If you’re tied up elsewhere and cannot start this job in the next two months.
Finally, if you’re certain you could be of added value to CEM, but don’t tick every single checkbox above – by all means, sell us! Tell us why in your cover letter.
What can we offer?
A competitive salary commensurate with your experience.
We’re a diverse group of 30+ dedicated, fun-loving employees based in downtown Toronto. We’re a small company. If you’re the right person, you can write your own ticket. Your growth at CEM is directly related to your effort and ability.
We’re in the middle of a digital transformation, which brings fun challenges and opportunities.
We offer a flexible and challenging work environment.
We’re a small company and unfortunately cannot respond to all applicants. Please keep your cover letter short and sweet and provide us with your resume. We appreciate your interest.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Location:
Toronto, ON (Preferred)

Title: Data Engineering Analyst
Description:
What is the opportunity?
You will play a key role in the development of new models and features for our Capital Markets ML Model Management platform. QTS Architecture team is focused on building standardized machine learning model integration mechanisms among various Capital Markets trading and settlement platforms and Back Office control functions Finance and Risk. RBC Capital Markets is a fast-paced business with frequently changing needs and requirements. You will help shape the future technology landscape by delivering key business values for different trading desks and implementing strategic components servicing ML models built by different teams. You are a highly engaged hands-on Self Starter who will build and drive efficiencies and enhancements within the Model Management Platform.

What will you do?
Perform analysis, support, maintenance, development and testing on multiple Machine Learning driven projects.
Create ETL tasks using Python & Airflow.
Create detailed technical specifications including standardized data definitions / model, data flows, technical requirements, and data mappings.
Analyze technical and system needs in order to build model interfaces and resolve issues by recommending model solutions that meet sponsor and stakeholder requirements.
Organize and participate in walkthrough reviews of all model specifications, programs and mapping requirements.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Haves:
2+ years Python experience.
Experience with Airflow/Luigi or any other workflow tools.
Experience with data science projects, large datasets, metadata capture.
Experience building and supporting machine learning models.
Experience with logical AI modeling.

Nice-to-have
Knowledge of Capital Markets product classes.
Expertise in model management projects including metadata capture, model lineage.
Knowledge of Big Data concepts and design challenges.
Prior capital markets modeling experience is highly desired.

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

Title: Reporting and Data Analyst
Description:
This position will be appealing to a self motivated person who thrives on working with big data-sets to form conclusions and help drive improvements from a global company perspective.
Data liaison
Manage and liaise with external software providers
Act as an internal reference point for data management and integrity
Pricing & performance
Develop and maintain the company’s pricing automation tools
Develop and maintain the company’s performance review engines
Management Information (MI) Reporting
Develop new reports and tools based on business needs
Train sales, claims, and underwriting to use MI tools
Prepare the company’s periodic reports
Create efficiencies in the MI reporting process and working with operational teams to streamline processes
Provide ad-hoc reports and information when requested
Provide first-class support with respect to the analysis and financial management of existing business
Data Governance
Develop methods and reports to capture data exceptions for review
Work with operational teams to ensure that processes are in place to capture the required data
Documentation
Review, test, and update existing documentation for the MI function
Provide support on other projects, as necessary

University degree in a quantitative field
Advanced knowledge of, and 1-2 years hands-on experience with Excel formulas and VBA code is required.
Experience with Cognos and/or other data management tools is preferred.
Strong mathematical aptitude
Strong problem-solving and time-management skills
Superior attention to detail and accuracy
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong ability to establish and maintain effective interpersonal relationships with co-workers
Demonstrated flexibility and effectiveness working under tight timelines
Demonstrated ability to adapt in a dynamic environment
Exposure to a financial or insurance industry is highly desirable
Strong Excel skills, with advanced knowledge of formulas, and some experience coding in VBA
Motivated, pro-active, and fast learner
Demonstrates the highest degree of professional ethics, honesty and integrity
A key element to this candidate’s success and assimilation into the DAS team will be his or her ability to embrace and embody our values. To become a part of this team, he/she must:
Exhibit a passion for playing an integral role in an entrepreneurial operation
Possess the confidence, astute business sense, and superior communication skills that are essential to success within this dynamic, high-performance organization
Be energetic, focused and thrive on the challenges associated with fast-paced, growing environments
Be innovative and solutions-oriented
Be a team player with a consensus building yet results-oriented style

We thank all candidates for their interest. Only selected candidates will be contacted. Munich Re is one of the world’s leading reinsurance companies with approximately 45,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe. As an industry leader, we provide a unique opportunity to be part of a global success story. We offer our employees a diverse and challenging work environment which champions high performance, professional development, innovation and passion; and rewards top performers with a highly competitive total rewards package.

Title: Data Solution Analyst II
Description:
Invesco is one of the world’s leading global investment managers, entrusted with managing $1.2 trillion* in assets on behalf of clients worldwide. We are the 6th largest US retail asset manager and the 13th largest investment manager globally, and our more than 8,000 employees worldwide are dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. We are purely focused on managing a comprehensive range of active, passive and alternative investment capabilities, which we draw on to provide customized solutions aligned to client needs, our most important benchmark. (*As of May 31,2019)

Job Purpose (Job Summary):
The role of Data Solution Analyst is to provide data quality solutions to Invesco’s internal clients globally. The candidate will work closely with other IS teams such as GIDS, GPS, GPRS to manage all aspects of data mastering and quality process development and support initiatives – across asset classes and geographies. The candidate will work within a global team of up to ten resources to execute against initiatives; including liaising and working jointly with GIDS and GPS team members and Technology department in global locations to provide 7x24 coverage to business stakeholders. The Data Solution team will work in conjunction with Technology teams and other key stakeholders to deliver data solutions using data enterprise management tools. This role will work with data owners, data stewards, data custodians and data consumers as the subject matter r expert on Securities reference data related topics. Other responsibilities include performing research/analysis, facilitate discussions with business partners and document outcome. The primary responsibility of the incumbent is to develop and maintain a robust stable Enterprise Data Management (EDM) platform contributing to the delivery of “a superior investment experience”.

Key Responsibilities / Duties:
Process design and implementation:
Execute workflow design build as set by senior members of Data Solutions
Assist in gathering business requirements for ongoing Markit EDM enhancements
Interpret and execute functional technical workflow requirements for EDM development
Review requirements with relevant stakeholders to obtain agreement and sign off of proposals
Assist in Build automated data master/quality solutions and Web user Interfaces on EDM platforms
Perform Quality Assurance checks on new EDM system workflows before implementation.
Update EDM design, data dictionary and process documentation.
System Integrity:
Monitor and report system issues to the team for review and resolution
Run test cases for Markit EDM system and application upgrade and enhancement
Work with IT technical support team to resolve Markit EDM hardware / application Production issues
Projects and Business support:
Participate in Data Solutions Projects and Data Solutions work streams of cross functional projects as assigned
Provide first-line support for relevant data projects and data enquires
Ensure support requests are handled promptly and accurately
Create and maintain scheduled reports for internal business partners
Participate in the implementation of scheduled Markit EDM process enhancement releases
Co-ordinate end user testing of EDM enhancement releases
Work closely with the other business units in GIDS and IS business units to execute other Data initiatives
Work Experience / Knowledge:
Prior experience with Markit EDM application preferred
Strong knowledge of SQL, SQL server database
Basic understanding of the end-to-end data flow/process design
Has a broad understanding of Investment operations as well as technology and its applications
Minimum 2 years of Investment industry experience in either an IT or Investment Operations role
Strong Microsoft Office skills – in particular Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Project and Visio
Prior work experience with other EDM applications (e.g. Eagle,Informatica) an asset
Ability to work effectively in a virtual environment that require frequent interaction with global colleagues with cultural diversity
Skills / Other Personal Attributes Required:
Facilitate collaboration within a team
Strong interpersonal skills necessary to effectively communicate over the phone with a variety of individuals at all levels and diverse business background in a confident and engaging manner
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Open minded, flexible, and willing to listen to and incorporate other people’s opinions and a strong “out-of-the-box” thinker who challenges status-quo
Customer focus and with a keen interest in providing superb services to clients
Strong organization skills, detail oriented, with an ability to understand the big picture
Research & analytical as well as problem solving skills
A team player with the ability to think on the feet and scenario plan
Able to work well under pressure and meeting tight deadlines
Formal Education: (minimum requirement to perform job duties)
A Bachelor’s in IT, Finance is required or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience that would provide the knowledge, skills and ability required
License/Registration/Certification: (minimum requirement to perform job duties)
CFA preferred but not required.
Canadian Securities Course (CSC) certificate or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience to fulfill the job criteria; Professional accounting designation (CMA, CGA or CA) or CFA an asset
Working Conditions:
Normal office environment with little exposure to excessive noise, dust and temperature.
May be required to lift, carry, or move weights of up to 10 pounds.
Frequent sitting and visual concentration is also required
Provide off-hour on call support as needed
Travel may be required

The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time.

Invesco is committed to fair and accessible employment practices. If selected for an interview, we will work with you to ensure that your interview is accessible and accommodation is provided. Please contact us at accessibility@invesco.ca or 1.800.874.6275 to let us know if you require accommodation for an interview due to a disability.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
You Are:
An ambitious and curious individual with a knack for analytics and data. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy diving into data sets to discover insights that ultimately support sound decision making. You are looking for a great role within a growing technical company within the IoT space.
We Are:
We are the company for you. We’re an emerging Internet of Things (IoT) company facing exponential growth.
Recently awarded the 2018 TCA Most Innovative Product, 2018 AI Innovation award, and Bronze 2019 InsureTech Innovation in Insurance Award, our technology is driving the widespread adoption of a smart water solution for homes and commercial properties. Our suite of products delivers industry leading water damage mitigation.
The Eddy team includes established entrepreneurs and business professionals, skilled inventors, and innovative data scientists and engineers. If you’re seeking to make your mark in the burgeoning IoT world with a supportive team, you’ll find your dream opportunity with Eddy Solutions. For more information on Eddy, please visit our website at: https://eddysolutions.com/
Responsibilities:
· Reporting to the Senior Data Analyst, analyze, generate, and deliver, target information using Eddy’s proprietary monitoring platform and cloud backend
· Conduct data analyses and produce actionable reports using SQL and Python or R
· Fulfill requests to develop metrics, analyses, and reports to provide key operational and business insight, as well as ad hoc data requests and extracts from various business groups throughout the organization
· Investigate and troubleshoot device behaviour using a data-driven approach
· Mine, organize, and analyze data to assist in providing strategic insights and reports to various internal groups, and to facilitate team objectives and goals
· Assist in resolving business issues by proficiently utilizing systems and data
· Utilize industry best practices relating to data collection, reporting and analysis
Requirements and Skills
Technical Skills:
· SQL – ability to explore the structure of a database, make assumptions about the data you are seeing, develop methods to validate your understanding and effectively extract reporting and insights.
· MS Excel – ability to effectively present and manipulate data in Excel.
· Python or R – Use Python or R to automate repetitive tasks and workflows, connect to databases and APIs, build pipelines, and perform basic ETL functions.
· Machine Learning – Familiarity with current machine learning algorithms and a data driven approach is an asset
· Linux/docker– Comfort using terminal sessions within Linux and familiarity with Docker would be useful as well.
Soft Skills:
· Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills – ability to interpret real-world data, detect patterns and use a variety of approaches, both methodical and creative when solving problems
· Troubleshooting and failure analysis – Develop an understanding of our systems to analyze and classify behaviour to provide insights for product improvements, service quality, and internal queries from front line staff
· Data Advocacy and Continuous Improvement – ability to conceive and implement ways to improve our data capabilities and processes to drive integrity and informed decision making.
· Prioritization – ability to work productively on multiple initiatives and balance expectations
· Strong Communication Skills – ability to extract key insights from data and communicate those insights to non-technical users in an actionable and engaging format.
Benefits:
Vision care
Extended health care
Dental care
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Data Analysis: 1 year (Preferred)

Title: Data Analyst, CIS
Description:
To support our continued growth and provide excellence in customer service and satisfaction, Reliance Home Comfort is looking for a high energy and results focused individual for the following role:
Position: Data Analyst
Location: Lansing, North York
Reports to: Manager, Data Analytics

Company Overview:
For the past 50 years, Reliance Home Comfort has been the industry leader in providing home comfort solutions to over 1.9 million customers across North America.
Our organization has doubled in size over the past five years and we are incredibly proud to be recognized by:
Waterstone Human Capital Ltd. as Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures
Waterstone Human Capital Ltd. for Canada’s Most Admired CEO (Sean O’Brien)
Glassdoor as “Best Places to Work in Canada”
Each day, 2,300 Reliance team members focus on delivering an outstanding customer experience, developing top talent and giving back to the communities where we live and work. In 2019 alone, we have donated over $650,000 to United Way and $100,000 in equipment to Habitat for Humanity.

CIS TEAM OVERVIEW:
The CIS team is responsible for the processes and systems in place in support of the Customer Billing Life-Cycle. Accountabilities of this group include the accurate delivery of bills and billing related communications to all customers, system enhancements and process improvements, ensuring timely and cost effective communication channels, support of customer on-boarding and acquisition, reporting and auditing activities and change management in support of corporate billing/bill payment strategies.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Acquire data from various systems within the business to build complete views of the customer base
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reporting
Filter and cleanse data based on analytical review and data health indicators
Responsible for delivery of data required for ongoing cross functional data projects
Work with manager to explore opportunities to provide data insight and appropriately build new reporting procedures
Undertake data analytics focused on a view of customer retention, acquisition with the purpose of delivering a best in class customer experience
Locate and design new process improvement opportunities
Manage ongoing relationships with vendors to obtain best outcomes
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:
Post-secondary education in engineering, mathematics, or business
2-3 years’ experience in a business analysis capacity
Experienced with Microsoft suite, including: Excel, Access, SQL, Sharepoint and Dynamics
Strong SQL experience including creating and updating scripts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Knowledge and experience with business analysis concepts, including: Business plan, Process Flow-charts, Business/System Requirements, Test Plan and deployment plan.
Strong understanding of data management and governance
Experience in billing systems and Kubra system would be an asset
Analytical thinker, flexible, resilient and resourceful, with a keen attention to detail
Strong knowledge and experience with reporting packages (i.e. Tableau)
Please note that this position requires a Criminal Background Check and Driver’s Abstract be completed for potential candidates (if applicable). This check must be satisfactory in order for an employment offer to be extended unconditionally.
Reliance Home Comfort is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds including minorities and those with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (DIGITAL AND DATA SCIENCE)
Description:
DIGITAL DATA ANALYST (DIGITAL AND DATA SCIENCE)

POSITION CODE: 2020-030
LOCATION: The Globe and Mail, Toronto
SALARY: Commensurate with qualifications and experience

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Analytics team at The Globe and Mail is looking for a Digital Data Analyst with strong fundamental skills in data analysis and visualization. This role will be instrumental in helping us make sure that everything we do is informed by data. The primary responsibilities for the analyst will be to model large volumes of data to design and implement custom reports and dashboards, and perform complex ad hoc analysis using raw data to extract useful insights and identify key trends. This role will support our User Experience group and will help them understand how continuous improvements that they make affect our bottom line.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analysis: Modeling and interpreting large volumes of data, identifying trends and extracting insights. Reporting the results and insights back to the relevant stakeholders.
Data Visualization: Create, maintain, enhance and automate various dashboards and reports that provide insights into user behaviour while keeping in mind business needs and goals.
Requirement Gathering and Documentation: Assist with documenting data sources, relationships between data entities and business concepts, and methods of calculation and measurement while understanding stakeholder needs.
MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:
Quantitatively focused bachelor’s degree with at least 3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
Excellent understanding of how A/B and Multivariate tests work as well as how to evaluate their performance and reliability
Experience working with Level of Detail, Table, and Window functions in Tableau
Experience working with analytical (OLAP, HTAP, etc.) databases (Teradata, Snowflake, BigQuery, etc.)
Command of analytical SQL (ex. Window Functions & Frames, Group Sets, Cubes, Rollups, etc.)
Comfortable working in a ‘self-serve’ capacity as a data analyst (i.e. retrieving and modeling your own data when so required)
Experience gathering stakeholder requirements with a demonstrated ability to get to the bottom of specific business rationale
Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment with tight deadlines
REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Data Visualization skills and at least a year of experience working with Tableau
Working knowledge of web analytics tools such as Omniture or Google Analytics
Working knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods
Understanding of JavaScript, CSS & HTML
OPTIONAL BUT DESIRABLE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience in directing and teaching non-technical stakeholders on use of analytics tools
Experience working with qualitative data and ability to evaluate its quality/draw insights
Basic understanding of managing Analytics and Marketing tags (via a tag manager or inline)



THE GLOBE AND MAIL INC. IS DEDICATED TO EQUITY IN THE WORKPLACE
At The Globe and Mail, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. The Globe and Mail offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst, Book Management (8 months), Capital Markets Su...
Description:
What is the opportunity?

The Data Analyst position plays a key role in supporting the data management strategy and goals for RBC Capital Markets. As part of an evolving and maturing data management function, this role is responsible for the management and maintenance of the book reference data used in our operational processes, supporting our data governance and quality controls, as well as participating actively in business and regulatory initiatives that have a significant data impact.

What will you do?

Support the operational processes that ensure the data content of BDR meets business, data quality, and regulatory requirements and standards
Interface with FO Stakeholders and internal clients as they relate to book data management
Contribute and collaborate on project initiatives
Support the capture, measure and report metrics on the dimensions of data quality that support business defined objectives
The employee is responsible for the integrity, quality and completeness of book data which is relied upon for the success of business, operating process and reporting

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
Demonstrates solid domain knowledge of the book data domain/trade flow process
Demonstrates solid understanding of how the book data management function intersects with other areas in Operations and RBC Capital Markets
Understands and has direct experience with data management concepts of data matching, cleansing, exception management and reporting
Must possess solid skills in utilizing Excel
Demonstrates confidence in engaging with the Front Office users

Nice-to-have
Excellent communication skills
Finance background
Ability to manipulate/edit macros

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
The employee will be able to gain experience in Capital Markets and better understand the trade flow process.
Will be exposed to different functions such as Risk team, Compliance, Finance, Operations team and will be able to gain knowledge from each function.
Will be able to gain experience in Capital Markets industry by getting to know the different products and services the bank provides

Join our Talent Community
Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.
