Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst, Finance

Here at Rakuten Kobo Inc. we offer a casual working start-up environment and a group of friendly and talented individuals. Our employees rank us highly in terms of commitment to work/life balance. We realize that for our people to be innovative, creative and passionate they need to have healthy minds and bodies. We believe in rewarding all our employees with competitive salaries, performance based annual bonuses, stock options and training opportunities.

If you’re looking for a company that inspires passion, personal, and professional growth – join Kobo and come help us make reading lives better.

The Role:
Rakuten Kobo Inc. is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Finance team! The team is an energetic and dedicated group of professionals that are highly involved in all facets of the business through the delivery of exceptional stakeholder value.

Reporting to the Director of Finance Content Business the Senior Data Analyst plays a vital role in supporting and delivering data analysis, reporting, and process improvement solutions for Rakuten Kobo’s digital content product offerings. In addition to this, the Senior Data Analyst is also responsible for the management and optimization of Rakuten Kobo’s payment processing fraud management platform.

The Person:
The ideal candidate will have an extensive technical background and is willing to build and enhance the teams existing data architecture, as well as develop new and more sophisticated solutions to current processes.

The candidate will be the “go-to” data person on the team and excellent communication skills are an absolute must. The candidate will work with all levels of the business and their ability to translate business needs into technical solutions will be critical to their success.

Key Responsibilities
Data architecture development and maintenance
Daily / Weekly / Monthly reporting support
Ad-hoc data analysis
Process optimization though technical solutions
Payment processing optimization and fraud management
Project management support

The Skillset:
Required:
5+ years in an analyst role
Proficient in SQL, Python, or similar languages
Ability to work with and manipulate large dataset efficiently
Self-motivated, creative, and a critical thinker
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Nice to Haves:
Payment processing background
Financial accounting knowledge

The Perks:
Flexible hours and no office dress code
Pooch Program that allows you to bring your furry friends to the office
Full benefits starting from your first day
Paid Volunteer days, unlimited sick days, and 3% RRSP matching
Monthly commuting allowance
Flexible health spending account
Talent and development training budget
Free Kobo device + free weekly e-book or audiobook
Frequent Lunch and Learns Author series
Weekly Kobo Tech University sessions
Onsite gym
Weekly happy hours (Thirsty Thursday’s, as we like to call it)
Maternity/paternity leave top up

About Rakuten Kobo Inc.
Owned by Tokyo-based Rakuten and headquartered in Toronto, Rakuten Kobo Inc. is one of the most advanced global ecommerce companies, with the world’s most innovative eReading services offering more than 6 million eBooks and audiobooks to 30 million + customers in 190 countries. Kobo delivers the best digital reading experience through creative innovation, award-winning eReaders, and top-ranking mobile apps. Kobo is a part of the Rakuten group of companies.

Rakuten Kobo Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Accessibility accommodations for candidates with disabilities participating in the selection process are available on request. Any information received related to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.
Rakuten Kobo would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this role however only qualified candidates will be shortlisted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:
OSL is a family of passionate and enthusiastic movers and shakers, over 5000 strong. We’re always on the lookout for awesome individuals to join our growing team. We are great people doing greater things, every day. Our promise is to help organizations drive sales through engagement by combining technology, process and passion to create engaging experiences that drive consumer purchase decisions. WE REINVENT THE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE. We connect people to brands through superior sales and customer service. Some of the largest retailers and brands on the planet hire us to deliver solutions to customers, not sales pitches.

Summary:

Reporting to the Data Systems Manager, the Data Analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. The Data Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Responsibilities:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely, accurate reports
Maintain and monitor production system alerts and provided triage support for priority systems.
Communicated state of service availability and continuity to business units
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Candidate Qualifications:
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regardingdata models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases, SQL, programming, XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets, Excel, SPSS, SAS
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent organizational skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of application flows and application development processes
Confidence and ability to work in a highly visible, fast-paced environment with minimal supervision, capable of delivering quality results with high expectations of workload output.
Adept at queries, report writing, data visualization and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset

Disclaimer: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an EEOC Employer.

Title: 1.0 Data Analyst Temporary
Description:
Internal/External Posting
The Near North District School Board requires a
NON-UNION
Data Analyst
Temporary Full Time
Mid-March to end of November 2020
Possibility of extension if funding is extended
Within the Technology Department and reporting to our Educational Technology Administrator and System Planner, the Data Analyst is an experienced professional who can work as part of a multidisciplinary team of technologists, educators, school and board administrators, and support staff. The Data Analyst has strong experience working with relational databases and has strong skills as it relates to data mining. Provides analytic support to Principals and System Leaders and maintenance to multiple board wide data warehousing applications. In addition, the Data Analyst will assist in the maintenance and upkeep of content within the School Board's web presence. Duties include data mining and report writing projects.
Location: North Bay Head Office
Duties and Responsibilities
Data Analysis, Data Mining, and Report Development as requested by the supervisor
Respond to requests for Survey Development and Survey Data Analysis
Support and Maintain specific applications as they relate to collecting, warehousing, and analyzing school board data.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Qualified Data Analyst will have graduated from a university or college business, technology or data analytics program. Two (2) years of acceptable experience is preferred.
Good working knowledge of Microsoft, Apple, and Google operating systems, platforms, hardware devices, and office productivity suites.
Demonstrated ability to work with Microsoft Power BI, SQL Server, SQL Server Reporting Services, and query development within SQL Server. Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel.
Extensive knowledge of 21st century technology tools, document collaboration, cloud based services, social media and other collaborative communication tools.
Previous experience working in a school board environment or with applications commonly used in the K-12 education sector would be considered an asset.
Strong organizational, technical, interpersonal, written, verbal communication skills with a focus on customer service and satisfaction. Excellent analytical skills with the ability to work independently.

Rate of pay: $37.20 per hour

Interested applicants please submit a resume and cover letter via applytoeducation.com

The Near North District School Board is committed to supporting an inclusive and accessible environment. Accessibility standards address issues that pose major barriers for people with disabilities (i.e. physical barrier, information or communication barrier, etc.). Please ask us how we may help you by contacting:
Human Resources Department
Phone (705) 472-7015 ext 5030

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.
The opportunity:
OpenText is looking for a candidate with strong SAP master data background and data analysis skills to be part of a diverse team with a focus on projects relating to data governance, master data architecture and management.
You are great at:
Having a deep understanding the SAP ERP master data ecosystem, including the fields, tables, and types of transactions which use the master data.
Understanding of data integrations, specifically how master data from SAP can impact downstream systems.
Understanding the Orders to Cash (O2C), Procure to Pay (P2P) and/or Record to Report (R2R) business streams.
Building and maintaining cross-functional relationships, including aligning opinions and approaches across disparate teams.
Using Excel for advanced data manipulations and analysis.
Assisting with designing business processes to be aligned to the master data
Creating or contributing to SOPs for the operational team.
Ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and completeness.
What it takes:
8+ years working with SAP or a similar ERP for maintaining master data, OR, a combination of master data management/governance experience and experience within the Orders to Cash (O2C), Procure to Pay (P2P), or Record to Report (R2R) business streams.
Experience with data migrations and integrations
Advanced Excel skills to perform data manipulations and analysis.
Knowledge and experience with master data tools such as SAP MDG, Data Services, Information Steward;
General understanding of project lifecycle & development
Ensure adherence to change control process
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and business-related work experience totaling 8+ years.
7+ years of providing data solutions in a similar setting.
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Excellent collaboration skills

Title: Senior Data Engineering Analyst, Data Governance
Description:
Location:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
Are you at the top of your game? Bring your expertise and knowledge to Canada’s largest retailer. We are looking for smart, nice and curious team members to help bring our Data & Analytics game to the next level. This is an exciting time to join our team – we are changing the game in a big way!
If you are looking to join a company that offers unlimited opportunity, excellent leadership, world-class training and makes a big impact on the community – this is the role you’ve been waiting for!
The Data & Analytics team at Loblaw is hiring a Sr. Analyst, Data Quality, with experience in working with big data. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Data Quality, the incumbent will be responsible for implementing framework and building processes to manage our enterprise data. This will include working with our data related policies, procedures, values and overall metadata to ensure consistency and accuracy throughout our business divisions and overall business to achieve ultimate goal of becoming a data-driven organization.
The successful candidate will have a strong foundation of data governance and the ability to work with large databases and data structures.
What You'll Do:
Design and develop data quality solutions within a cloud environment using world-class tools and technology
Drive data discovery and analysis to assist strategic business initiatives within noSQL data structures
Proactively review and provide creative recommendations on improving data quality
Consult with internal and external stakeholders to uphold data quality and data management best practices
Elicit business requirements by collaborating with data stakeholders and translate them into technical requirements
Support the execution on the enterprise wide data governance framework
Assist in root cause analysis and driving resolution of critical production data quality issues as needed
Deliver training and education as needed to business stakeholders on data quality solutions and best practices
Provide advisory to stakeholders as needed
Demonstrate Loblaw CORE values
Other duties as required
What You'll Need
4-6 years related work experience
Post-secondary education in business, information technology management, engineering or computer science
Understanding of data governance and data quality principles an asset
Experience with data quality tools (e.g. Informatica Data Quality) and business intelligence tools (e.g. Microstrategy, Qlik) is an asset
Proficient at writing complex queries and validating results using SQL and Python
Experience in cloud-based platform such as Google Cloud, Azure, Amazon Web Services required
Experience assessing data quality within noSQL database structures such as mongoDB and neo4j required
Experience with using natural language processing techniques for data quality activities an asset
Experience with Atlassian tool stack required
Strong prioritization and organizational skills
Ability to effectively facilitate meetings and discussions with stakeholders
Ability to effectively negotiate for a successful outcome
Ability to multi-task with strong attention to detail and analytical skills
Ability to operate efficiently within an agile project management framework
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Regular
Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.
Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

Title: Data & Reporting Sr Business Analyst (AVP level)
Description:
The IT Business Senior Analyst is responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.

Responsibilities:
Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects and foster communication between business leaders and IT
Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommends solutions
Support system change processes from requirements through implementation and provide input based on analysis of information
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support
Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
5-8 years of relevant experience
Experience in data analysis with intermediate/advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills
Proven interpersonal, data analysis, diplomatic, management and prioritization skills
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
Proven ability to manage multiple activities and build/develop working relationships
Proven self-motivation to take initiative and master new tasks quickly
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and approach work methodically with attention to detail
Education:
Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience
Responsibilities:
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and partner with multiple teams and other units to meet organizational objectives
Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of scope, objectives and system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects
Evaluate evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate enhancements.
Work with global BA and Dev teams to perform data analysis. Basic knowledge of data modeling is a must
Provide in-depth and sophisticated analyses with interpretive thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and influence strategic functional decisions
Collaborate with developers to translate business requirements into technically feasible and efficient solutions and transition requirements to QA team and assist in test scenario development
Oversee project deliveries to ensure they remain on track and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
We highly encourage you to apply if you have the below demonstrated experience:
Requirements Gathering and Documentation
Good understanding of Trade Data Flow Processing
Business Intelligence and Data Visualization
Statistical & Business Analysis
Data Transformation and Big Data Migration
JIRA, Confluence, SQL
Stakeholder experience at varying levels
Project Management
Additional Qualifications:
5+ years of experience
Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint) with extensive experience using Excel for data analysis
Experience with all phases of Software Development Life Cycle
Understanding of Data Modeling and ER model
Comprehensive knowledge of the principles of business analysis
Functional knowledge of Fixed Income trading flows
Experience writing SQL and analyzing and producing data models
Prior experience working with front office stakeholders (Traders, Quants, Bankers ) or finance/product control teams
Ability to create presentations for senior management provide input on overall product roadmap and strategy
Citi Canada is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities (including, without limitation, physical and mental health disabilities) during the recruitment process and otherwise in accordance with law. Individuals who view themselves as Aboriginals, members of visible minority or racialized communities, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Title: Senior Application Support Analyst - (Service Desk / Inciden...
Description:
Address:
YSC - 2 Sheppard Avenue East
Job Family Group:
Technology
Responsibilities:
Lead the team in monitoring, service restoration, changes, support, and handling day-to-day activities (7/24/365) required to Run the mission critical IT systems for the company ensuring business Service Levels are met, environments are managed.
Leads the team in monitoring Service Desk requests, as well as coordinates and facilitates Incident Management, deploys changes to the production environment, and engages 3rd party providers contracted to the Bank during an incident
Executes fail-over and/or Disaster Recover of infrastructure and applications in support of business continuity plans of the company
Works with development teams to build solutions that use enterprise monitoring/logging, are “self-healing”, and require minimal to zero maintenance.
Possesses strong technical and/or business functional knowledge of systems, timing and dependencies.
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Leads/Conducts incident recovery and detailed root case analysis.
Deploys manual code to production environment.
Facilitates or completes analysis, design and configuration of viable solutions to highly complex technology problems that would improve data center and support activities.
Provides end to end technology support including computer, applications, network and storage, and root-cause analysis etc.
Drives and/or promotes new processes, systems, technology, and operations and expanded capabilities for performance, with the flexibility to align to the unique requirements of the project teams and deliverables.
Proactively monitors system performance and identifies operational improvements, in ensuring smooth and consistent customer and business partner delivery.
Supports deployment activities, managing implementation issues to resolution.
Provides initial triage, investigation and ensures fast turnaround times on issue/incident resolution.
Monitors technical infrastructure, applications and/or business transactions through automated systems and instrumentation across the environment.
Provides inbound call assistance to end-users for application, technical, and IMACD needs leveraging the knowledge base and/or run books available.
Collaborates and engages with the appropriate areas across the bank.
Develops or helps to develop the knowledge assets required for the operation.
Promotes adherence to standards and industry best practices.
Develops an understanding of organizational interactions and complexity to engage with the appropriate matrix areas.
Identifies opportunities to strengthen the operational capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across technology.
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Core Knowledge:
Typically 2-4 years of work experience in IT or business environment and/or B.S./B.A. in computer science, engineering, information systems or math.
Proficient level of knowledge in MS SQL, Netezza or other data warehousing environments would be beneficial.
ITIL Foundation Certification and experience working in a ServiceNow incident management environment would be an asset.
Working knowledge of ESP, AutoSys, Control-M or other batch scheduling software would be an asset.
Understanding of Information Technology operating processes used for systems to ensure effective delivery including but not limited to IT Operations mandatory operating standards for monitoring, logging, and alerting.
Knowledge of support and operations practice, concepts, and technology obtained through formal training and/or work experience.
Technical and/or business functional knowledge of systems, tools, timing, and dependencies.
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth
We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: Consultant, Data Analyst
Description:
Company Information

Farber is an independent business advisory firm that provides practical solutions to complex financial and operating problems. We have a reputation for responsiveness and a track record of helping our clients achieve their objectives and overcome challenges.

We successfully partner and work with the leadership of North American companies, their advisors, lenders and other professionals. Our diverse team of business-savvy professionals operate seamlessly to provide services across the areas of restructuring, financial, human capital, and consulting.

With offices in Toronto, across Ontario, Calgary and Vancouver, Farber is positioned to advise businesses across Canada. Our global alliance extends our reach and provides opportunities in North America, Europe, Asia, Africa, and beyond, reflecting the increasingly global nature of business. Established in 1979, Farber continues to grow by fostering an unparalleled collaborative approach and by actively aligning interests with our clients.

Making business work better, together.™

Position Summary

Working in a fast-paced environment, our team of consultants help companies crystalize their strategy, enhance operational performance, improve leadership and clarify a vision for the future—one designed to deliver sustained profitability over time. Using targeted performance measures, we provide data-driven insights that will eliminate waste, improve performance, and help companies do what they do better.

Are you a natural problem solver? Do you go the extra mile to exceed clients’ expectations? Do you like to have fun while working hard? Come join our team. As a Consultant, Data Analyst you will have a key role in tackling advanced and challenging problems our clients face, including understanding new markets, framing new business models, and informing strategies to increase the bottom-line.

Responsibilities
Meet with clients to understand business and data requirements
Analyze complex data sets and use statistical tools to determine trends or patterns
Develop and implement automated dashboards and analytic tools (Excel, Power BI)
Build presentations and reports to provide insights for business performance and strategic planning
Present recommendations and support clients through implementation
Lead business development efforts including preparing proposals and conducting client spotlights
Support projects across a variety of industries and functions
Manage stakeholders across clients and within other business units at Farber Group

Qualifications

We hire based on proven experience, potential, and on fit with our unique culture. We expect the successful candidate to have the following criteria:
Bachelor of Science in mathematics, economics, computer science, information management or statistics
2-4 years proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Power BI etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, etc)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication and presentation skills; comfortable interacting with executive level management
Willingness to travel if required, but most of our clients are within the GTA

We invest in your learning experience to provide the tools and support for development catered to your career goals. We will give you opportunities to communicate with executives, learn the mechanics of how businesses work in a variety of industries, and gain expertise in business management tools used by organizations for efficiency and productivity.

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Farber Group and its entities will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. We thank all candidates for submitting their resume, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst (MS Dynamics)
Description:
Seeking a Data Analyst to be engaged on a 1 year contract in North York, ON.

Must have skills include:
Demonstrated experience with mobile, web and/or CRM products
Demonstrated experience in Microsoft Dynamics 2016.
Demonstrated experience working in an agile environment
Demonstrated experience creating dynamic data visualizations and dashboards
Demonstrated experience in developing and delivering presentations using a range of software tools
Key Responsibilities
Provides technical expertise using data analysis techniques in support of data driven decision- making.
Contributes to the development of analytical models.
Connects a variety of business data with location information and analyzes data to gain additional insights.
Ensures data quality and performs data cleansing.
Produces data visualization on a range of different data sources, including structured, unstructured, real-time and geospatial.
Troubleshoots issues associated to data and reporting.
Develops, fosters and maintains effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborates on processes that continuously monitor data quality.
Provides support on creation and maintenance of data dictionaries and metadata.
Participates in business requirement workshops and supports the documentation of business requirements.
Performs research on best practices related to data analysis and data visualization.
Communicates analysis results to internal and external stakeholders.
Compiles data/statistical reports based on data analysis.
Qualifications:
Post-secondary education in the field of quantitative analysis (i.e. Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Geography, Mathematics, etc.)
2+ years of experience with mobile, web, and/or CRM products
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2016 is a plus
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience writing SQL queries in MS SQL
Experience cleaning, manipulating and analyzing data with either Python or R
Experience creating dynamic data visualizations and dashboards (i.e. Plotly, R Shiny, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
Experience developing and delivering presentations using a range of software tools

Knowledge and Skills:
Ability to write and contribute to the development of reports
Ability to perform qualitative and quantitative analysis (i.e. descriptive statistics, inferential statistics, regression analysis, content analysis, etc.)
Ability to gather client business requirements
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment
Ability to analyze structured and unstructured data
Problem solving, mathematical reasoning and critical thinking skills
Knowledge of location analysis using open source or commercial of the shelf (COTS) software applications (i.e. ArcGIS, QGIS, etc.)
Knowledge Transfer - The Vendor will ensure that appropriate Knowledge Transfer is performed throughout the engagement. This will be done through formal and informal training, documentation such as but not limited to requirements, design, test cases, defect track log, source code and runbook, presentations and job shadowing.
We would like to thank you personally for applying to Step by Step Professional Services Inc. Please note that we will review your application and only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise.
You can also follow our corporate Linkedin page for job updates:
https://www.linkedin.com/company/step-by-step-professional-services-inc-/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hope and Healing International is currently looking for a Data Analyst.
Everybody wants to make a difference. To leave the world a better place than they found it.
Are you looking for a challenging, exciting career that changes lives here and in poorer countries? Join our team.
About us:
We are Hope and Healing International, a Christian organization, bringing hope and healing to kids and their families living with disabilities in the poorest communities of the world. Hope and Healing works in communities to improve access to healthcare, education and livelihood opportunities for people with disability.
Scope of position:
Reporting to the Manager, Finance, the Data Analyst works to meet the information needs of Hope and Healing International, leveraging data to support decisions, and drive results.
Employment Status: Full-Time (35 hours per week), Salaried
Salary: TBD + Benefits & RRSP
Location: 3844 Stouffville Road, Stouffville, ON
Essential duties and responsibilities:
Business analysis
Contribute to the implementation of innovative solutions to drive efficiencies, and excellence in our day-to-day operations
Use analytical abilities to make recommendations on opportunities, leveraging your understanding of our business environment and our data
Data reporting and analytics
Develop, generate, and maintain customized reports supporting Hope and Healing International business and management teams
Data queries as required to support business activities
Data planning
Collect information from various stakeholders for any new system/code change requests
Evaluate risks, benefits and efforts associated to any change
Apply changes to the system as required
Targeting and segmentation
Assist Marketing Department in selecting targeted donors and then send list of donor information to the required parties for different campaigns
Set up letters for Donor Services in Donor Management system including ‘thank you’, 'welcome’ and various administrative letters in responding to our donors
Add related communication records regarding the donors to system database
Data management
Day-to-day management of Hope and Healing International’s donor management system/CRM and its database ecosystem, ensuring data quality, availability, and integrity.
Provide “first level” support to various departments regarding any data related issues
Liaise and communicate with 3rd party software vendors to resolve any issues regarding data/information
Upload donors information from system database to other platforms
Ensure integrity of donors records and overall data
Additional duties as required
Provide data expertise to the Hope and Healing International staff as required
Develop and implement software/ applications to meet business needs or drive business effectiveness
Assist / make recommendations in development of procedures, policies, and systems
Provide input into company decisions regarding software and hardware using knowledge of latest trends and applications
Why would you want to come and work with us?
You will work shoulder-to shoulder-with people as excited about changing the world as you are
You can bring your faith to work – it makes for an awesome atmosphere
We believe in work-life balance so we offer 15 paid vacation days starting from the first year of service, 10 paid personal days and days off to volunteer and for spiritual growth
You will take on a significant role in changing the world
Skills and qualifications we’re looking for:
Bachelor Degree/College Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or related disciplines
3 to 5 years of progressive experience in data analytics or relevant field
Systems administration/testing experience
Fluency in SQL, BI and report development
Superior computer literacy and proficiency in all office productivity software including Microsoft office suite (Excel, Word, Access, etc.)
A thorough understanding of data structures – preferably experience with CRM Systems
Knowledge of Visual Studio Development environment, Software Development, Business Analysis, and marketing analysis and reporting
Creativity and innovation
Attention to detail
Ability to organize and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines and objectives
Ability to follow given directions, guidelines and instructions
Ability to communicate complex concepts to all levels of management
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information
Data warehousing or OLAP cube experience (Excel/Pivot tables) would be an asset
Experience in SSIS, SSRS, and SSAS would be an asset
DBA skills, Windows networking and background in VB.net and C# an asset
Working conditions and other requirements:
Standard office environment
Must be fully committed to the core values and mission of Hope and Healing International
Must have a reliable source of transportation
Please forward your resume by March 17, 2020.
In Accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities (AODA), Hope and Healing International strives to ensure that all recruiting processes are non-discriminatory. If you require an accommodation, please advise HR in advance of attending the interview.
Hope and Healing International is a ‘children-and-adults-at-risk-safe organization’. As a condition of employment, successful candidates will be required to undergo Vulnerable Sector Screening from the police jurisdiction in which they reside.
Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. All other applicants are thanked for their interest.
Benefits:
Extended health care
Vision care
Vacation & paid time off
Life insurance
Flexible working hours
Work from home opportunities
Wellness programs
Employee assistance programs
Company events & social hours
On-site parking
Disability insurance
RRSP Match
Dental care
Casual dress
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $60,000.00 to $65,000.00 /year
Experience:
data analytics or relevant field: 3 years (Required)
systems administration: 3 years (Required)

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
Cardinal Health is seeking a Data Management Analyst to add to our team in Vaughan. The Data Management Analyst is accountable for the integrity and maintenance of Master Data to support the health of the system functionality. This individual is responsible for analyzing Master Data procedures and content in order to highlight areas of improvement. They will work collaboratively and cross-functionally with other Teams, namely Business Intelligence, Sales, Supply Chain, and Marketing, to develop suggested solutions that will gain efficiency and accuracy for the master data, such as Item Master, Customer Master, and Supplier Master.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop cross-functional relationships with Business Intelligence, Supply Chain, Sales, Marketing and Application Services regarding the maintenance and workability of master data content.
Provide ownership of the processes involved in master data maintenance and implement improvement strategies to standardize the approaches to these functions.
Conduct data profiling and analysis to validate master data integrity and consistency.
Develop and maintain monitoring procedures to alert respective data owners about data exceptions. Identify root causes for repeat errors and suggest process and/or system improvements.
Identify KPIs to measure and report data quality. Track and report results of data quality improvement initiatives.
Create and maintain documentation necessary for master data governance. Educate organization on master data process changes and data management best practices
Perform regular data management duties related to item merchandising, item cost changes and analysis, and other data maintenance as required.

Know-how and Experience:
A bachelor’s degree in business, engineering or computer science is an asset.
An excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Understanding of master data principles
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel
Working knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to provide coaching and training to others.

Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting an accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.
Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Purpose:
This position plays an integral part in enabling insightful data analytics used in decision-making at Stericycle. The Data Analyst is a proactive, analytical individual contributor specializing in uncovering entitled revenue opportunities and estimating the respective revenue impact. Takes further actions necessary to support the revenue recovery. Key Job Activities:
Design, prepare, and review data by leveraging internal business intelligence applications and platforms to identify or estimate entitled revenue opportunities for functional leaders. Takes appropriate actions required to support the revenue recovery.
a. Execute routine and/or adhoc reporting as required to support leadership, field operations, and business analysts.
b. Perform data mining and analysis for ad hoc projects. Effectively presents data in a manner that is easily understood to support decision making.
Effectively communicate findings and complex analytical solutions to management team.
Perform rigorous quality assurance steps to deliver highly accurate and reliable work products.
Incorporate on-going feedback from stakeholders into existing reports, dashboards, and analyses. Education: Preferred Education: in Bachelors or Equivalent Experience (North America & LATAM): Required Years of Experience: 0-2 Experience (EMEAA): Certifications and/or Licenses: Disclaimer:
Disclaimer: The above description is meant to provide a summary of the nature and level of work being performed; it should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and requirements of the job. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise. Stericycle will consider requests for workplace accommodations for protected physical or mental limitations in accordance with its human resources policies and local laws. To the extent permissible under local law, and consistent with business necessity, Stericycle reserves the right to modify the content formally or informally, either verbally or in writing, at any time with or without advance notice.

Title: Data Developer/Analyst - 289334
Description:
Data Developer/Analyst Procom KW is currently seeking an experienced Data Developer/Analyst for our large enterprise client in the financial services industry.

Data Developer/Analyst Job Details
Working in a fast-paced agile team environment, the Data Developer/Analyst will work with the system query building, maintain Java programs and work with developers of internal teams and vendor developers.
Data Developer/Analyst Responsibilities
Troubleshoot Data discrepancies (MS SQL Server and Cloud data store)
Manage and resolve User Incidents (Jira and Confluence), Single Sign On, and Active Directory
Understand ETL processes to reach data from SAP/Callidus web service (Informatica/SQL/JAVA skills required)
Understand Client Side ProducerHUB MS SQL Server DB. This is required due to XML to Web Service change on the SAP/Callidus side and due to 1:1 mapping. (SQL, Data/DB Modeling, RDMS skills required)
Adjust internal ETL processes to reach data from a different model (Informatica/ETL skills required)
Coordinate work between downstream stakeholders and vendor (SFTP concepts, Structure for file transfer etc. skills required)

Data Developer/Analyst Must Haves
Diploma or degree in Information Technology or Computer Science, with at least 6 years' experience in IT, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience with SQL server, Oracle or DB2
Experience in writing SQL queries
Minimum 4-5 years’ experience with Java (using Spring Boot frameworks)
Basic Informatica knowledge
Knowledge of Reporting tools like Business objects
Experience handling large data feeds from multiple source systems
Experience with web technologies: HTML/DHTML, CSS
Experience working within an Insurance or Financial environment
Strong experience with a role focused on data, compensation, workflow models
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills

Data Developer/Analyst Nice to Haves
Jira and Confluence

Data Developer/Analyst Start Date
Immediate

Data Developer/Analyst Assignment Length
Initial 6-month contract to start

Title: Kinesso - Data Analyst
Description:
About Kinesso
Kinesso brings together the best minds in data, technology and media activation to deliver seamless data-driven marketing solutions. As a technology-enabler, Kinesso powers marketing systems through a proprietary suite of applications that integrate ad tech and martech. Kinesso’s application framework spans audience, planning and activation, delivering insights and business outcomes for leading global brands. Learn more at www.kinesso.com.
Position Summary:
We are looking for an analytical thinker with a love for using their technical knowledge to solve business problems and is experienced with KPI reporting and data visualization techniques.
Responsibilities:
Extract, review and prepare data on media campaign effectiveness to create regular client reports in Excel and Tableau, assisting in solving complex client problems
Design and build data visualizations and dashboards for the purposes of monitoring, understanding and optimizing media performance
Perform proactive and reactive analyses to ensure data integrity
Work closely with Business Intelligence team to continue to automate processes and ensure database architecture is adequate for growing client needs
Analyze data to recommend campaign execution and visualization improvements, based on data and observed trends
Develop findings that can be presented to agency team members and clients
Qualifications:
BS/BA in Statistics, Economics, Math, Computer Science, Marketing or applicable experience
1-2 years of experience in an analytics-based role
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Excel, SQL, or VBA
Experience with visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Datorama, Data Studio)
Experience with web analytics, digital media measurement and reporting platforms preferred (I.e. Google, Facebook)
Strong communication skills (verbal & written); ability to provide concise, clear reporting and actionable analysis
Ability to pull data from multiple sources and formulate comprehensive and actionable reports
Proven ability to self-check work to ensure results are error-free
Ability to plan, organize and work on multiple tasks simultaneously
IPG Mediabrands is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage applications from all interested parties. Accommodations are available, upon request, for those with a disability or medical need during any stage of the recruitment process. We thank all candidates for their interest in IPG Mediabrands, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Clinical Trials Data Anonymization Analyst
Description:
IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.
Clinical Trials Data Anonymization Analyst
This position is with Privacy Analytics’ Clinical Trials Transparency (CTT) team in Ottawa, Canada. For more information about Privacy Analytics, please visit us at https://privacy-analytics.com
Our Professional Services team is growing. We’re hiring Clinical Trials Data Anonymization Analysts to support an expanding line of business. In this role you’ll be end-to-end responsible for anonymization projects of client data sets. Using our tools you will analyze and mitigate the risk of re-identification for trial participants whose data appears in clinical trial Structured Individual Patient (S-IPD) data sets. As an ideal candidate you learn quickly and can produce extremely accurate, precise work within tight timelines. You’re familiar with clinical trial data formats (CDISC SDTM, ADaM), medical / healthcare language, comfortable with numbers and statistics, and your excellent communication skills are complemented by strong technical acumen and the ability to meet tight deadlines.
Responsibilities:
Develop familiarity with our de-identification methodology.
Own assigned projects or project tasks and deliver such on time and with the required quality, providing timely and transparent status updates and managing client expectations.
Process clients’ clinical trials data set. Core responsibilities here include: Pre-processing (loading and cleansing) data sets, understanding and classifying tables, variables, and relevant relationships. and / or:
Identify and classify direct and indirect identifiers, measure and mitigate re-identification risk, determine and apply required data transformations.
Facilitate the creation of anonymization reports and other client deliverables.
Collaborate closely with other team members, ensuring that all work meets established quality standards and is completed on time. Participate in peer-reviews of work products.
Identify and communicate tool enhancements/refinements and relate defect documentation to developers and researchers.
Qualifications:
Exceptional detail-orientation.
Ability to understand and interpret structures and variables in clinical trial data sets.
Ability to learn our methodology and develop a thorough understanding of how directly and indirectly identifying information contributes to the risk of re-identification.
This is generally demonstrated through experience and comfort with scientific and quantitative disciplines for example, clinical research, STEM fields, etc.
Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills.
The drive to meet exacting deadlines and the flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities.
Ability to manage sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality.
Working experience with SQL (MS SQL server), SAS, R, and statistical analysis of clinical or healthcare data would be a great asset, but are not a requirement.
Candidates ideally would have a degree in one of the following or closely related fields:
Biostatistics
Statistics
Mathematics
Epidemiology
Neuroscience
Biomedical Science
Regulatory Affairs
Pharmacy
Pharmaceutical Sciences
Pharmacology
Pharmacovigilance
Medicine
Biomedical Technology
Biotechnology
Genetics (Medical)
Biology (Medical)
Biomedical Informatics
Bioinformatics
Medical Informatics
Infection and Immunity
Health Sciences
Nice to have / beneficial assets:
CDISC SDTM / ADaM working knowledge.
Ability to understand and navigate MedDRA terms and their hierarchy.
Medical writing or trial data programming experience.
Experience with Adobe PDF and MS Office products (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint).
Join Us
Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.
Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

Job ID: R1120294

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Reporting to: Senior Solutions Architect
Responsibilities & Duties:
- Data validation/scrubbing between in-house central SQL server database and other third-party sources
- Manage/Create daily batch job schedule, debug and rerun failed jobs
- Take ownership of issues by carrying out problem analysis to implement temporary or permanent fixes with the aim of restoring service to an employee as soon as possible; escalating incidents to other support teams where necessary
- Keep procedure manuals up to date
Qualifications & Skills
- Solid knowledge of database design and writing SQL Server queries, view & stored procedure, is a MUST
- Trouble shooting and failure resolution skills is a MUST
- Extensive understanding of RDBMS
- Experience with Bloomberg terminal is a plus
- Proficient with Microsoft Office with advanced knowledge of Excel
- Familiarity with portfolio accounting practices, reporting, and trading
- Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues at all levels in the organization
- Excellent interpersonal skills with a customer service orientation
- Ability to work in a busy environment with frequent interruptions while prioritizing and resolving user requests
- Exceptional attention to detail
- Self-starter, able to work under minimal supervision
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
- Team player with a positive attitude
- Availability for occasional off-hours or weekend tasks
Benefits:
Extended health care
Vacation & paid time off
Dental care
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Engineering Analyst, Data Governance
Description:
Lieu:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
C’est toute une décision que de se joindre à une entreprise. Nous offrons des perspectives d’emploi à des personnes qui, comme vous, sont travaillantes, dynamiques et fiables.
Pourquoi ce role est-il important?
Comment R é ussir:
Chez Loblaw, nous recherchons toujours des personnes formidables pour continuellement renforcer notre culture. Nous croyons que les gens formidables façonnent nos valeurs, sont authentiques, bâtissent la confiance et créent des liens.
Si cela vous ressemble et que vous êtes ouvert d’esprit, que vous avez une bonne attitude face aux changements et que vous aimez les défis d’un environnement de travail aux détails dynamiques, postulez aujourd’hui.
En outre, nous croyons que la conformité aux lois consiste à faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre Code de conduite; il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous.
Type d'emploi:
Temps plein
Role:
Poste régulier
Loblaw considère que la diversité culturelle du Canada est une source de fierté nationale et un symbole de force. Nous nous sommes donné comme priorité de refléter la diversité croissante du Canada dans les produits que nous vendons, les gens que nous embauchons et notre culture d’entreprise. Des accommodements sont disponibles sur demande pour les postulants et collègues atteints d’un handicap.
Remarque : Si vous avez accès à Libre-service de l’employé (ESS) dans Workday, veuillez postuler à cet emploi en utilisant l’application Workday.

Title: Consultant, Data Analyst
Description:
Company Information
Farber is an independent business advisory firm that provides practical solutions to complex financial and operating problems. We have a reputation for responsiveness and a track record of helping our clients achieve their objectives and overcome challenges.
We successfully partner and work with the leadership of North American companies, their advisors, lenders and other professionals. Our diverse team of business-savvy professionals operate seamlessly to provide services across the areas of restructuring, financial, human capital, and consulting.
With offices in Toronto, across Ontario, Calgary and Vancouver, Farber is positioned to advise businesses across Canada. Our global alliance extends our reach and provides opportunities in North America, Europe, Asia, Africa, and beyond, reflecting the increasingly global nature of business. Established in 1979, Farber continues to grow by fostering an unparalleled collaborative approach and by actively aligning interests with our clients.
Making business work better, together.™
Position Summary
Working in a fast-paced environment, our team of consultants help companies crystalize their strategy, enhance operational performance, improve leadership and clarify a vision for the future—one designed to deliver sustained profitability over time. Using targeted performance measures, we provide data-driven insights that will eliminate waste, improve performance, and help companies do what they do better.
Are you a natural problem solver? Do you go the extra mile to exceed clients’ expectations? Do you like to have fun while working hard? Come join our team. As a Consultant, Data Analyst you will have a key role in tackling advanced and challenging problems our clients face, including understanding new markets, framing new business models, and informing strategies to increase the bottom-line.
Responsibilities
Meet with clients to understand business and data requirements
Analyze complex data sets and use statistical tools to determine trends or patterns
Develop and implement automated dashboards and analytic tools (Excel, Power BI)
Build presentations and reports to provide insights for business performance and strategic planning
Present recommendations and support clients through implementation
Lead business development efforts including preparing proposals and conducting client spotlights
Support projects across a variety of industries and functions
Manage stakeholders across clients and within other business units at Farber Group
Qualifications
We hire based on proven experience, potential, and on fit with our unique culture. We expect the successful candidate to have the following criteria:
Bachelor of Science in mathematics, economics, computer science, information management or statistics
2-4 years proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Power BI etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, etc)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication and presentation skills; comfortable interacting with executive level management
Willingness to travel if required, but most of our clients are within the GTA
We invest in your learning experience to provide the tools and support for development catered to your career goals. We will give you opportunities to communicate with executives, learn the mechanics of how businesses work in a variety of industries, and gain expertise in business management tools used by organizations for efficiency and productivity.
We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Farber Group and its entities will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. We thank all candidates for submitting their resume, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Experience:
data analysis: 2 years (Preferred)
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Preferred)

Title: SENIOR DATA ANALYST & INTEGRATOR (Data Engineering)
Description:
Job ID: 5261
Job Category: Information & Technology
Division & Section: Parks, Forestry & Recreation, PFR Policy & Strategic Planning
Work Location: METRO HALL, 55 John Street
Job Type & Duration: Full-time, Permanent Vacancy
Hourly Rate and Wage Grade: Preliminary, $45.47 - $49.82, Please note: The salary reflects
2019 rates
Shift Information: Monday to Friday, 35 hours Per Week
Affiliation: L79 Full-time
Number of Positions Open: 1
Posting Period: 26-Feb-2020 to 11-Mar- 2020
Job Description

Working in the Business Intelligence, Research and Analytics unit in the Policy and Strategic Planning Branch of PFR, you are a data engineering professional who works collaboratively on solving complex problems for a division that stewards public spaces and brings the public together. You'll be working directly with staff in data science, data engineering, and a variety of business functions, on building pipelines and optimization models. With access to a variety of data sources internally and externally to the City of Toronto, there's no shortage of data and problems to tackle. Most importantly, you can seamlessly distill very technical concepts to business users and vice versa; bringing colleagues and stakeholders along the journey of discovery and learning through data analytics is very important to you.

Major Responsibilities:

Data Science, Research and Analytics
Provides technical expertise in using data analysis techniques to City divisions to support of data driven decision making.
Leads development and supports the coordination of corporate analytical models.
Implements industry best practices on machine learning, artificial intelligence, and digital twinning, resulting in operational improvements and project success.
Uses data science to formulate solutions and/or recommendations.
Creates and uploads for dissemination and/or planned email reporting.
Compiles data/statistical reports based on data analysis.
Produces data visualization on a range of different data sources, including structured, unstructured, real-time and geospatial.
Troubleshoots and takes actions to resolve issues associated to data, interpretation and reporting.

Data Engineering
Builds core ETLs/ELT, refactor queries and data models, and provide strong analytics to support the decision making process.
Supports data pipelines, builds queries and ETLs/ELTs, and supports statistical and inferential analysis. Integrates a variety of business data and analyzes data to gain additional insights.
Connects to and transforms data from each source to match the format and schema of its destination.
Coordinates and collaborates with Corporate I&T BI team to ensure high performance of large amounts of ETL as well as ELT tasks, report building, analytics, and data visualization support.

Data Quality and Governance
Develops data quality evaluation processes.
Guides the creation and maintenance of data dictionaries and metadata.
Ensures data quality and performs data cleansing.
Provides technical support to divisional teams in the development, use, and quality assurance of data collection methods (including geospatial) for business intelligence and analytics. Produces technical documents pertaining to data analytic processes, analysis, methods and models.
Participates in design and evaluation sessions of data analytics and machine learning processes with objectives to conduct testing, devise audits and support implementations.

Stakeholder support and Communication
Develops, fosters and maintains effective working relationships and communication with internal and external stakeholders on project requirements and approaches related to data analysis, visualizations, data quality, and project delivery timelines.
Participates in business requirement workshops and supports the documentation of business requirements.
Builds relationships and liaises with key business users and decision makers to understand their business analytics needs.
Represents the team and gives presentations at relevant learning networks, meetings and events related to data science. Delivers presentations based on findings.
Maintains up-to-date knowledge of both the current and emerging data analytics technology and products.
Provides direction to the Data Analyst & Integrator regarding data analysis as related to data structures and architecture.

Key Qualifications:

Your application must describe your qualifications as they relate to:

Post-secondary education in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent combination of education and experience, or a related field.
Considerable experience with big data processing frameworks and techniques such as HDFS, MapReduce, Syncsort, Sqoop, Oozie, etc.
Considerable experience using programming or scripting languages like Java, Linux, C++, Python, or R.
Considerable experience writing complex SQL and NoSQL jobs to analyze data in both traditional DBMS (MS-SQL, Oracle) and Big Data environments (i.e., HADOOP, SPARK, or similar open source and commercial technologies).
Experience with data streaming using Kafka, Apache Spark and data ingestion frameworks: NiFi, Hive and Pig.
Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning (scikit-learn, Tensorflow, MLlib, recommendation systems).
You must also have:

Ability to structure and transform data to enable analysis.
Collaborative attitude, willingness to work with team members; with the ability to coach, participate in code reviews, share skills and methods.
Exceptional oral, written and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts into business & value-focused language.
Ability to communicate clearly and consistently keeping stakeholders well-informed of progress and challenges.
Excellent organizational and time management skills, strong business presence with the ability to multi-task and effectively deal with competing priorities.
Excellent interpersonal skills, critical thinking, problem solving and conflict resolution skills.
Ability to develop and maintain inter-professional team relationships with multiple stakeholders, including City staff and the public.
Excellent political acuity.
Ability to create and effectively present information and facilitate discussions with various audiences.
Ability to travel to various locations in Toronto.

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion
The City is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse residents that we serve.

Accomodation
The City of Toronto is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive organization. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Western

Since 1878, Western University has been committed to serving our communities through the pursuit of academic excellence and by providing students, faculty, and community members with life-long opportunities for intellectual, social, and cultural growth. We seek excellent students, faculty, and staff to join us in what has become known as the "Western Experience" - an opportunity to contribute to a better world through the development of new knowledge, new abilities, new connections, and new ways to make a difference.
About Us

Transforming Education. Transforming lives. We foster informed global citizenship through transformative educational opportunities. We are an engaged academic community guided by the values of integrity and ethics, equity and social justice, and academic and research excellence. We are deeply committed to the delivery of innovative research-intensive and online professional academic programs, which aim to enhance equity and accessibility for all learners; rigorous research defined by high academic and social impact; and culturally and socially responsive service that aims to produce high-quality outcomes that positively affect education and benefit all of society.
Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will be responsible for:
Data cleaning
Data analytics
Manuscript writing

Qualifications

Education:
PhD in a relevant discipline

Experience and expertise:
3 years' experience using interRAI data bases
Ability to conduct quantitative analyses
Western Values Diversity

The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Western is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.

Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwo.ca or phone 519-661-2194.
Please Note:

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be acknowledged.

Title: Sr Data Analyst Engineer - DealerTrack Canada
Description:
About Dealertrack
Dealertrack Canada is the leading provider of web-based software solutions and services for all major segments of the automotive, marine, recreational vehicle, motorcycle and powersport retail industries. Dealertrack Canada serves dealers, lenders, OEMs, third-party retailers, agents and aftermarket providers with its comprehensive set of solutions including Sales/F&I products; market data for dealers, lenders and OEMs; and digital document services. Dealertrack Canada is a subsidiary of Dealertrack, which is owned and operated by Cox Automotive Canada. For more information about Dealertrack Canada, visit dealertrack.ca.
Job summary

This position will join our growing team of data and analytics experts for Cox Automotive Canada. You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. You will support our data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery consistent throughout ongoing projects.
The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of Cox Automotive Canada. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.

Responsibilities:
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Recommend different ways to constantly improve data reliability and quality
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Improve upon the data ingestion pipelines, ETL jobs, and alarms to maintain data integrity and data availability.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics
Performs other job-related duties as assigned or apparent and Stay up-to-date with advances in data persistence and big data technologies


Qualifications:
Graduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field
Big Data Certification and AWS certification would be an asset
Must have strong Data Orchestration experience using tools such has AWS Step Functions, Lambda, AWS Data Pipeline, Apache Nifi.
In-depth knowledge of AWS Big Data Services
Must possess in-depth knowledge and hands on development experience in building Distributed Big Data Solutions including ingestion, caching, processing, consumption, logging & monitoring)
Must have a strong understanding and experience with Cloud Storage infrastructure and operationalizing AWS based storage services & solutions prefer S3 or related specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets
Strong Data Cataloging experience preferably using AWS Glue
Experience in building processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable data stores
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
Experience deploying data pipelines with CI/CD
Experience working with complex Data Warehouses
Working experience on Big Data Lake and Data Lake Zones.
Experience with streaming analytics (Kinesis/Kafka) is a plus
What we offer:
Full time employment with one of the global leaders in automotive remarketing realm
5 weeks paid vacation per year
Generous Insurance plan paid by Cox Automotive Canada (medical, dental, life, disability).
RRSP contribution plan
Venngo Discount programs
Fast paced, multicultural work environment
Career pathing – opportunity for development and advancement within Cox Automotive family of companies
Opportunity for involvement with local communities though company sponsored volunteering program
Cox Automotive Canada was named one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers


About Cox Automotive
Cox Automotive Inc. makes buying, selling and owning cars easier for everyone, while also enabling mobility services. The global company’s 34,000-plus team members and family of brands, including Autotrader®, Clutch Technologies, Dealer.com®, Dealertrack®, Kelley Blue Book®, Manheim®, NextGear Capital®, VinSolutions®, vAuto® and Xtime®, are passionate about helping millions of car shoppers, tens of thousands of auto dealer clients across five continents and many others throughout the automotive industry thrive for generations to come. Cox Automotive is a subsidiary of Cox Enterprises Inc., a privately-owned, Atlanta-based company with revenues exceeding $20 billion. www.coxautoinc.com
Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual’s age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Cox employees, Cox hiring manager, or send to any Cox facility. Cox is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:
The Data Analyst position is part of the KIK Custom Products – Information Systems team. The incumbent will design, test, monitor and troubleshoot ETL and Analytic processes. This role will work closely with integration and analytics developers. The incumbent will support the processes in a standards-based environment, deployed globally and accessible across the organization.

This role is based in Concord, ON but will have responsibilities for global locations with travel requirements ranging from 10-15%.

Responsibilities:
ETL Development
Design, direct and implement ETL processes, including data capture, data quality, testing and validation methods.
Analyze different sources of data and develop ETL processes to integrate them to our system.
Understand the source data components and how they integrate with each other (which might be both relational and dimensional).
Develop ETL processes using standard database sources, file sources and Web sources (XML, Web Service, REST, SOAP).
Monitor daily ETL jobs and troubleshoot issues in Production environments.
Analyze data requirements, study complex source data, and determine the best methods of extracting, transforming and loading data into different database (which might be both relation and dimensional).
Provide assistance with the design and development of test plans and scripts for ETL processes.
Support quality assurance and user acceptance tests.
Analytic Solutions
Design, direct and implement analytical solutions for all KIK ERPs.
Analyze different sources of data and develop data models including transactional and dimensional.
Perform data profiling activities for the different source systems.
Understand main databases for KIK ERPs.
Support quality assurance and user acceptance tests.

Orchestration and Scheduling
Build workflows for new integration processes using existing orchestration tools.
Build jobs and plans for integration processes using existing orchestration tools.
Debug and troubleshoot existing orchestration tools.
Automate integration processes.

Performs other related duties as assigned
Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Management, Computer Science, or another business-related field is preferred.
5+ years of experience in Microsoft SSIS, Visual Studio 2015 and above.
5+ years of experience in Web technologies: XML, XSD, XSL, HTTPS, Web Services, FTP, SFTP
2+ years of experience in process orchestrations and job scheduling tools such as SQL Server Agent, Active Batch, etc.
Knowledge of cloud applications.
Expert knowledge of RDBMS (Oracle, MSSQL).
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure technologies.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, written, and listening communication skills.
Time management and analytics skills.
A Career with KIK Offers:

KIK offers very competitive salary and comprehensive benefits including health, wellness, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance. You can plan for your future with KIK's retirement savings options including employer match. KIK also recognizes the importance of continuing education and offers Education Assistance to our employees to encourage continued personal development and growth.

Thank you for your interest and consideration of a position with KIK Custom Products.

KIK is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, age, religion, sex, or national origin.

Accommodation is available upon request.
